answerText: electrons[10] This technique is complementary to XPS. In it, electrons are ejected from an atom due to an internal reorganization caused to fill a vacancy in the core shell. The ejected electrons are given a 3-letter tag such as KLL to denote the three subshells involved.
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | 7 | 12 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Hemispherical capacitors are common instrumental components in one form of spectroscopy involving these particles. [10] Name these particles which are emitted from a surface in XPS, which uses the photoelectric effect to measure their binding energy, which is specific to the particular atom and orbital they were ejected from.
